what: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Interactive Feature-Rich Data Viewer R dataviewR powerful Shiny-based interactive data viewer transforms way explore R data frames tibbles. intuitive interface advanced features, provides comprehensive data exploration capabilities automatic code generation reproducible workflows.

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Interactive Data Exploration: View R data frame tibble elegant Shiny interface Advanced Filtering: Apply complex dplyr-compatible filter expressions live preview Dynamic Column Selection: Easily select deselect columns checkbox interface Automatic Code Generation: Generate reproducible dplyr code data manipulations Metadata Display: Access detailed variable information data attributes Data Import Panel: Built-data import functionality data provided Responsive Design: Clean, modern interface works across different screen sizes Export Capabilities: Save filtered selected data analysis

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: # Install from CRAN (recommended for most users) install.packages("dataviewR")

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: â€™re using R versions prior 4.3.0, may need install source:
code: # For R 4.2.x and earlier install.packages("dataviewR", type = "source")  # Alternative method using devtools devtools::install_version("dataviewR", version = "0.1.0",                           repos = "http://cran.r-project.org")

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: # Install the latest development version from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("madhankumarnagaraji/dataviewR")

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: # Install from R-universe (often has additional binary support) install.packages("dataviewR",                   repos = c("https://madhankumarnagaraji.r-universe.dev",                            "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: library(dataviewR)  # Launch with built-in datasets dataviewer(mtcars) dataviewer(iris)  # Launch with your own data dataviewer(your_data_frame)  # Launch without data to use the import panel dataviewer()  # Example with pharmaverseadam data (if package available) # install.packages("pharmaverseadam") dataviewer(pharmaverseadam::adae)

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: interactive interface provides: - Complex Filtering: Use dplyr expressions like mpg > 20 & cyl == 4 - Column Management: Select/deselect columns intuitive checkboxes - Data Sorting: Click column headers sort data - Code Export: Copy generated dplyr code reproducible analysis - Attribute Inspection: View variable labels, types, metadata - Search Functionality: Find specific values across columns - Variable Levels NA Visibility: Displays distinct values character factor variables, including NA, within quick filter box.

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Perfect initial data investigation understanding

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: # Use dataviewR to explore, then copy the generated code library(dplyr)  # After using dataviewer(mtcars), you might get code like: filtered_data <- mtcars %>%   filter(mpg > 20 & cyl == 4) %>%   select(mpg, cyl, hp, wt)

what: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
text: Launches Shiny application explore filter data.frame tibble. data provided, opens import panel load dataset either global environment packages.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
text: ... One data.frame tibble objects. none provided, import UI shown load data interactively. background Logical. TRUE, runs app background R process using callr. Requires callr package. Default TRUE dataset(s) provided, FALSE dataset(s) provided. port Integer. Port number Shiny app. NULL, random available port used. Default NULL.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
text: background = TRUE, returns process ID (character) invisibly. background = FALSE, returns Shiny application object.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
text: function provides: tab-based interface data import viewer options. Support multiple datasets separate tabs. checkbox panel select/deselect columns. input dplyr-compatible filter expressions. dynamically generated dplyr code preview. Metadata display variables. filtering uses dplyr::filter() generates user-friendly code replicate steps. also provides copyable R code includes column selection filtering logic.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation â€” dataviewer
code: if (interactive()) {     dataviewer(mtcars) # Opens in RStudio Viewer pane or default web browser     dataviewer(iris, mtcars) # Opens multiple datasets in separate tabs     dataviewer() # Opens the "Import Dataset" tab (foreground mode - console will be busy)      # Run in foreground to enable the "Import Dataset" tab alongside 'mtcars'     dataviewer(mtcars, background = FALSE)      # Stop background process     id <- dataviewer(mtcars, iris)     stop_dataviewer(id) }
